reviews.sentence: Beautiful Stay. We had a great stay the room was confortable and clean the area is quiet and relaxing.
Wonderful hotel. Shower was awesome. Easy access to highway. Free parking was readily available. great beds. very comfortable mini frig in room.
Clean nice hotel only negative is the shuttle service. Shuttle drivers were great just the time and room on shuttles.
Airport Hotel. One night near downtown. Very nice property excellent room.

Clean modern comfy. After traveling California for a week we were set to fly out of Sacramento and decided to stay at a nearby hotel. I went to trip advisor to look for the best place to stay. There were three other hotels a few miles closer and near shopping but a lot more expensive. I read the reviews for this hotel and decided to try it out. We were not disappointed. Beds were comfy pillows soft yet full giving some support. Bathroom was large and clean. New TV. I truly have nothing to complain about this place. The staff were friendly. I have stayed at many hotels throughout the country including California and this one was on the top of my list for comfort cleanliness. modern touches such as TV bedding and the price was very reasonable.

courteous staff but not well trained. I booked a king bed room and was given a 2 queen bed room. Why would one traveler need two beds. During check in the staff did not explain that to me at all. When I got into the room and found it is wrong I called but was told no king bed. I did not trust them but I had urgent things to take care the next day so did not argue. The checking out also taking longer than expected since I asked a receipt. They obviously did not know how to print one out immediately. very clean and excellent location. you can easily find a good restaurant that fits your taste. need more staff training. my room is noisy during morning too close to a highway.

Night before leaving for the UK. Really nice hotel for the night if we stop in Sac for a weekend would be happy to stay again the room was very clean and the bar and restaurant were also very nice. lovely that they had a free shuttle to the airport as we needed to be there at 6 am highly recommend for a short stay.

Nice but Needs some cleaning. It was a nice place. AC did not work in our room. Pool was small for such a large Hotel. Room had ample space. Asked for a refrigerator prior to check in never got one. Dead bug smashed on the wall and they did not clean it off the wall. Bathroom was outstanding. Beds are comfy. Close to Sac airport.
Would definitely stay here again. Came in late from traveling everyone was friendly and the room was great.

Excellent place to stay. Hotel is beautiful the room was amazing and the beds als I can say is WOW. Best sleep I have had in a long time. Acomadations were perfect. Definitely will stay here again when I have an early flight out of Sac airport.

Secret Gem. Very please that this place was available. Easy check in clean facility friendly staff close to freeway and comfortable room. Location free wifi comfort Plenty of places to eat. Store and gas was close. Near main freeway Bigger tvs in the room maybe a mini fridge in the room.
Wish I had stayed at Lyons Gate. Nothing. This place was horrible. did not give me the right room. did not get breakfast. Spider eggs in my room. Not cool. Terrible place.

Last Place after more than 100 nights in hotels this year so far. After staying more than 100 nights in hotels this year this property by far is at the bottom of the list. The bed should be thrown out or donated to a prison for further punishment. The chair should be dropped off at a homeless camp nearby and while your at it please give them all your shower gel and shampoo as this is so overpowering in perfume cologne of someones grandpa. Regarding the bed I kept trying to roll to the peak in the center but the badly collapsed side of the bed kept pulling me down into the bottom of the pit. Your chair in the room is so filthy I did not want to soil my clothes sitting in it. You should consider moving the coffee maker out of the armoire as you can not even pour water into it to make coffee. You need to make an improvement on outlets as well. Most people like to have an outlet accessible at the night stand. I was able to do this after moving the nightstand away from the wall and unplugging your lamp. Your front desk is unresponsive to phone calls. after calling a few times and being put on eternal hold I had even asked that you all call me back. never happened. Your carpets in many common areas are disgusting and should be changed. I can tell you that when I first arrived I had a very good impression as the front desk area was ok and the people at the front desk were very friendly. Like the old saying goes You can not judge a book by its cover. This cover truly fooled me. In all my reviews be it on hotel properties and on Trip Advisor I rarely give a bad review at all. I am sorry but this place is the worse.

Convenient airport hotel. Reserved an accessible room. Room was large with good access EXCEPT the tub shower had NO handicapped capability. The tub shower was a conventional step over type. There was no shower seat in room or available on premises. Access to airportShower tub needs to have seat AS A MINIMUM.

Great hotel and staff. This hotel is in a wonderful area close to shopping restaurants and the freeway. My room was clean and comfortable. My favorite part of the room was the bathroom all white without a speck of debris. I will definitely return.

I liked the ease of booking online and did not have any issues with our room. Only stayed one night. Checking in was a breeze and scheduled for a complementary shuttle pickup to the airport for the next morning. Went down to the bar for a quick dinner and drinks and was greeted with a smile. Bartender was attentive and gave us prompt service. Although as we were settling into bed before an early flight out we could hear the other guests above us walking around but not enough to keep us awake. The shuttle was right on time the next morning. Overall a nice stay and would visit againwould have been nice to have a small fridge.

I was only there in the River room for a professional seminar. As far as that went however it was very good. Spacious dual projectors and large screens for clear viewing. The catering was tasty and parking was easy.

Never have I ever. had such bad customer relations. I am a business traveler … in hotels almost every week of the year and usually loyal to the same hotel. Within the SPG Mariot brandcorp booking my expectations are always clean and safe. My filters include gym business center with printer near airport airport shuttle free parking complimentary park n fly restaurant lounge on premises quiet between the rooms. I have been pretty successful with hitting all of these in past choices with Four Points. And with my loyalty they have extended way beyond my expectations with drink tokens laundry service free breakfast … etc. Until now. I am newly assigned to Sacramento and on paper this hotel seemed to work. But I can say that I will NEVER stay here again. Other than the nice respectful lounge waiter and room clean staff this property is a disaster. Made Corp Reservations through SPGcom for 2 rooms 3 nights each in January. My co worker was traveling with me. The day of travel he had to cancel until the next day. No problem … I would take care of it at the hotel. Airport Shuttle. I get to SMF retrieve my bag and call the hotel to confirm pickup area. They had told me it runs every half hour 10 minute ride. I called at 126. I was put on hold for 5 minutes. Then told that because I did n’t call by 125 the shuttle is not coming. I had to wait until the 20 pm shuttle. Called Uber. Hotel Check in. I checked in and advised the second room would not be checking in until the next day. She advised they have a 48 hour cancellation and I would be charged. And the room would have to be re booked on a rate that was 60 higher per night. But she would get permission to “ let ” me check into both rooms to keep reservations. I showed my corporate reservation which clearly states I can cancel up to 60 pm day of travel with NO penalties. “ That is not our policy ”. She completely disregarded the SPG guidelines for corp travel reservations. Hotels were sold out in the area so I checked into both rooms so I did n’t lose the reservation and planned to challenge this with SPGKeys. Old key system — if your key even comes close to your cell phone. It deactivates. Happened at least 2 times a day as I drop everything in my purse. Constant traffic to the front desk from many guests while the staff was busy trying to explain to phone calls about the ridiculous 48 hour cancellation policy. GYM. TVs on cardio do n’t work. no antibacterial wipesRom noise. I could hear the next room using the bathroom. Thank goodness I was so high from the wafting MJ from below I fell asleep. Business Center. Out of OrderCofe. I can not think of any hotel that does not have coffee in the lobby 24 hours. After work out went over for a cup there is a set up in the restaurant area and asked for a cup. Was advised “ my rate does not include breakfast ”. I did n’t want breakfast just a cup of cofeSo we stuck it out and checked out after the 3 days. Called SPG who fought with them for over an hour before hotel agreed to refund. Left my car there for the weekend … but returned and could n’t stomach staying there again. Returned to this hotel 2 weeks later … only because no credit yet and mysterious 70 charge on my card. Figured it was easier discussing while “ giving them a second chance. ”Stil no wipes in restaurant no coffee in lobby business center in op … same issues. Felt like I had to start my “ credit ” conversation all over with 5 different people manager is never available. And the 70 charge. For 3 days of weekend parking. As “ rate on the last stay was not park n fly ”. Although I checked the rate and I paid the same. Noting all the construction trucks parked in the back lot I asked one of the workers … the lot is city property. So they are “ selling ” city property for parking. Hm. I am pretty sure they charged me out of revenge.

I am with a corporate group. I wanted to pay for a members room on my card. It took over an hour with me using my personal cell phone and the hotel using my personal cell phone to allow me to pay for the room on my corporate card. No one apologized for the delay no one offered anything. We found a hotel closer to our meeting at a cheaper rate and better service we checked out early and we were charged the full rate for the next day as an early departure fee. I will try and find a way to dispute this. We hold big board meetings with hotel stays and use of meeting rooms. I will not use this hotel again for our meetings or hotel stays.

I stay here when I am catching a flight from Sacramento International to the Midwest. I have done this maybe a half a dozen times. The flight leaves very early in the morning and I prefer to catch the motel shuttle to the airport rather than being up most of the AM. From the airport a call to the Four Points will bring the shuttle which arrives at the baggage area where the taxis wait. The rooms are clean the receptionists a little snooty and the restaurant cooks with too much garlic. There was a Subway and Walgrens across the street. The rooms are excellent and it is always great to start my travel with a good nights sleep when starting early.
Very noisy fans in my room. One in the bathroom and one the a c.

Fancy on the surface but a little odd. The hotel had recently been renovated and this was apparent in the public areas of the hotel. They were lovely. The desk attendant was also very welcoming and friendly. Overall the hotel was as I would expect it to be for an airport friendly location. It was also only 2 3 minutes from several restaurants which was super handy after a long day of flying. At first glance the hotel room looked fabulous. It was by no means a dump and I would not avoid the property in the future. However we could had difficulty getting the room cold enough to be very comfortable at night. Given that it had been recently renovated we were surprised that there were not USB charging ports on the nightstands or bedside lamps. Just regular plugs. The bathroom was clean and VERY VERY WHITE. So white so bright that it was a bit like the surface of the sun. Some of the finishing work in the bathroom was haphazard see photos of the ceiling sprinkler and wall to the right of the sink. There were wall mounted dispensers in the shower for shampoo conditioner and body wash. I know this is to reduce waste and I support that. But there was only one bar of soap provided in the bathroom hand soap and my partner hates body wash under any circumstances and definitely without any kind of pouf to help lathering. I had the same problem. Overall the place was just fine but could have been perhaps better designed.

The room was acceptable but the restaurant was disappointing. Not many choices when it came to dinner. They had things on the menu that they were not serving due to people not liking it. There is a free airport shuttle and its close to the airport. I would not stay there again if I had the choice. For the money I expected more.
Okay. The noises and screeching of the water in the bathroom all night made it virtually impossible to get restful sleep. Not have been located next to the utility room.
Four Points Sacramento Airport. Location. They had a restaurant but no information was in the room giving menu options or prices or if room service was available.
I had a great stay but please work on you HVAC system. There was a huge leak of water outside of my AC unit.

The room I did n’t expect. I have a handicap adult daughter who on oxygen I have machine that needs to be in room when she sleeps I did n’t know they were giving me a room up stairs 3rd floor. Your site did n’t let me tell them my needs lucky for us they had a downStairs room available with king size bed and they we ’re going to add spare bed but as it turned out there were two queen beds in room. The room was perfectly comfortable for my needs at the same price I booked room. Thank you.

Disappointed. I have stayed in this hotel many times in the last 5 years while traveling to Sacramento. Apparently under new management they have substantially lowered the quality of the place with cost cutting. We stayed in 2 different rooms about a week apart. BOTH rooms had plumbing issues the shower drains were partially blocked resulting in ankle deep water while showering. As we all know plumbers are expensive and management is kicking this can down the road. The hotel provides the absolute minimum amount of towels for 2 people plus the single TINY bar of soap was inadequate. The super cheap shampoo and body wash supplied thru a wall dispenser in the shower was so caustic it gave my wife a rash from using it. There was NO Kleenex anywhere. The once decent breakfast buffet has also been hit by the bean counters too the once delicious fresh fruit has disappeared. The cost cutting clearly has lowered the quality of this hotel. I am surprised the Mariot chain has permitted their name on this economy hotel. In defense of the hotel it was clean and the staff was great. I struggled to give this hotel 3 stars. I will probably spend a bit more and go elsewhere next visit.

Great very clean big for great value just watch your reciept. I loved how new and clean and correct the pictures looked when we came in. i was in love with the barn doors for bathroom too. I would of given all stars and an excellent review but when I booked with one price and then checked out and noticed after my receipt was more I called and was told they did overcharge me 40 dollars which was supposed to be credited back. hope they keep their word. But if so everything was great for the price. Sorry not everyone can spend 200 a night that is a quarter of my rent.

There were dirty towels hanging in the bathroom and what appeared to be human feces on the bedshets. I told the front desk and they made me wait 30 minutes at 930 pm so someone could change my sheets. Did not grab the dirty towels from the bathroom and did not comp me or offer another room. Horrifying in every sense of the word.
